author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Tamilnadu Science and Technology Centre will be making arrangements for the public to witness the total solar eclipse at Elliots Beach on March 9.

Globally, the eclipse begins at 4:49 IST and ends at 10:05 IST. Partial phase of the eclipse will be visible in many parts of India in the morning.

In Chennai, the eclipse ends at 6:48 IST. The centre will be setting up telescopes with suitable filters, solar goggles and Welder’s glasses at Elliots Beach from 6 a.m. to 7 a.m.

The centre has also advised the public to not look at the Sun directly, during partial or annular eclipse, without any eye protection.

It might lead to permanent eye injury or loss of eyesight.
title: Head to the beach to watch solar eclipse
